meanings.sent1: Lack of sleep can impair your ability to focus.
meanings.sent2: The storm impaired the roof of the house.
meanings.sent3: Trying to play soccer with a deflated ball will impair your game.
meanings.sent4: The virus impaired his sense of taste, making everything bland.
meanings.sent5: The rusty lock was so impaired that the key wouldn't turn.

meanings.definition: To diminish in quality or value
meanings.sent1: Leaving the painting in the sun may impair its colors over time.
meanings.sent2: Using cheap materials can impair the durability of the product.
meanings.sent3: Eating ice cream for every meal might impair your appreciation for other foods.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise in the city impaired the peacefulness of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The scratches on the phone screen impaired the overall appearance of the device.
